channel.title: Docs on Derivatives
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on Derivatives

item.title: README
item.description: Derivatives is an exploration of all things original and copy. Articles about origins and originality, published here in derivative form, constitute the bulk of this book. Each of these articles has already been published under an open access (CC-BY) license elsewhere. Original publications have been stated on each article. The aim of this book is to ponder about text reuse, origins and copying—and why these things appear to bother people so much.

item.title: ON THE ORIGIN OF CREATINE
item.description: ON THE ORIGIN OF CREATINE.1 By L. BAUMANN and J. MARKER. (From the Laboratories Medicine, of the Departments State University of of Physiology and Internal Iowa, Iowa City.) (Received for publication, June 12, 1915.) The search for possible precursors of creatine has always led to a consideration of substances containing the guanidine radicle, as arginine and glycocyamine, or methylamino groups, as sarcosine, betaine, and choline. Van Hoogenhuyze and Verploegh2 found no increase in the elimination of creatinine, after the ingestion of proteins relatively rich in arginine.

item.title: Detecting the origins of moisture over Southeast China: Seasonal variation and heavy Rainfall
item.description: ADVANCES IN ATMOSPHERIC SCIENCES, VOL. 33, MARCH 2016, 319–329 Detecting the Origins of Moisture over Southeast China: Seasonal Variation and Heavy Rainfall Xiuzhen LI1, Wen ZHOU2[^∗], and Yongqin David CHEN3 (Received 24 March 2015; revised 25 August 2015; accepted 2 September 2015) ABSTRACT To examine the ability of the Hybrid Single-Particle Lagrangian Integrated Trajectory (HYSPLIT) model to detect the origins and paths of moisture supplied to Southeast China, trajectories of air particles released over Southeast China were traced backward during 1 April 2012 to 31 March 2013 and three typical regional persistent heavy rainfall events.

item.description: Skip to main content Advertisement SpringerLink Search Log in SCHWERPUNKT Open Access Published: 17 February 2021 Ralf Kneuper, Sven Jacobs Softwaretest mit Originaldaten Eine Analyse aus Sicht des Datenschutzes # Ralf Kneuper & Sven Jacobs Datenschutz und Datensicherheit - DuD volume 45, pages 163–167 (2021)Cite this article 288 Accesses Metrics details Zusammenfassung Der Wunsch nach einer Nutzung von Originaldaten für den Softwaretest führt in bestimmten Konstellationen zu einem Konflikt zwischen der Zweckbeschränkung von personenbezogenen Daten einerseits und der Forderung nach Qualitätssicherung der Systeme zur Verarbeitung dieser Daten andererseits.

item.title: What is Morita Therapy? The Nature, Origins, and Cross-Cultural Application of a Unique Japanese Psychotherapy
item.description: Skip to main content SpringerLink Log in Original Paper Open Access Published: 07 July 2020 What is Morita Therapy? The Nature, Origins, and Cross-Cultural Application of a Unique Japanese Psychotherapy Holly V. R. Sugg1, David A. Richards1 & Julia Frost1 Journal of Contemporary Psychotherapy volume 50, pages 313–322 (2020) Cite this article 4846 Accesses Metrics details Abstract # Morita Therapy is a Japanese psychotherapy which contrasts with established Western approaches in teaching, through behavioural experience, that symptoms are part of the natural ecology of human experience.
